image.altText: Two soccer plays chase a ball.

props.synopsis: Just last year, the club won the league, and a former president was given a suspended jail sentence for stealing $20k. Now they are going to fold.

title.children: Last year they won the comp, now this football club is folding

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe previously pleaded guilty to stabbing his co-worker Tshewang Choden to death in the kitchen area of the National Zoo and Aquarium in Canberra, where they both worked, in 2023.

title.children: Man who murdered Canberra Zoo co-worker 'remains infatuated' with her

image.altText: A group of four people walk our of a court building, with a blur over one of their faces.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of covertly gathering information for the Chinese government has been granted bail in Canberra, despite police warning she could try to flee the country.

title.children: Chinese national charged with foreign interference granted bail

image.altText: Bonnie Jantke looks down as she plays piano.

props.synopsis: Many people struggle to approach the subject of death with family, and what kind of care they want to receive in their final months or years.

title.children: The conversation families avoid, and why it matters when time runs out

image.altText: Former US military pilot Daniel Edmund Duggan seen as a pilot in Tasmania

props.synopsis: US authorities want Dan Duggan extradited from Australia for allegedly training Chinese pilots in South Africa in 2012. An appeal to avoid the extradition has started in the Federal Court today.Â

title.children: Former US Marine pilot appears in person at appeal against extradition

image.altText: A light aircraft flying

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau says the aircraft likely experienced icing, but it is unsure why the pilot did not attempt recovery actions.

title.children: Investigators don't know why a light plane crashed near Canberra, killing four

image.altText: A wild koala in the fork of a gum tree.

props.synopsis: The construction of new homes in Canberra's north remains on hold after a koala was spotted. Now, a dead koala has been found nearby.

title.children: A koala sighting halted a new suburb. Now, one's been found dead

image.altText: Three prison officers in riot gear pin down a female detainee.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court has made public confronting video showing the moments leading up to a strip search that violated an Aboriginal womanâs human rights.

title.children: Video of events before improper strip search in Canberra's jail released

image.altText: Pharmacy medication

props.synopsis: Pharmacists in the ACT will be able to offer more treatment options to patients, under changes set to take effect from early 2026.

title.children: ACT pharmacists set to be able to offer more treatment options

image.altText: Protesters hold up placards saying "No kings since 1776" and "don't pretend your racism is patriotic".

props.synopsis: Millions of Americans are expected to take to the streets this weekend as part of nationwide protests against US President Donald Trump. Here's what to know about the events, which could see the single biggest day of protest in US history.Â

title.children: Anti-Trump rallies to draw millions in 'single biggest day of protest' in US history

image.altText: March for Australia organiser seen coordinating with NSN member

props.synopsis: A previously unreported video has emerged appearing to show a key March for Australia organiser coordinating with a Neo-Nazi at the first rally in Sydney in August, ABC NEWS Verify has found.

title.children: Fresh video casts doubt on March for Australia NSN claims

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu sits among a crowd of people at a memorial.

props.synopsis: As the dust settles on the ceasefire and hostage exchange deal, the question arises as to whether the partial resolution could deliver Benjamin Netanyahu a bounce in the polls.

title.children: Netanyahu isn't liked in Hostages Square, but what about broader Israel?

image.altText: A white 4WD with Red Cross symbols on the front, parked next to a group of people and a mound of rubble and demolished building

props.synopsis: Israel says it has received nine of 28 bodies held in Gaza, and Hamas says it needs heavy machinery and excavating equipment to speed up the process of locating bodies buried under rubble.

title.children: Hamas hands over another Israeli hostage's body

image.altText: Donald Trump in a dark suit, white shirt and red tie gesturing with his right hand while speaking at a presidential lectern

props.synopsis: The US military has launched six strikes on Venezuelan vessels the Trump administration claims were involved in drugs trafficking, and some are warning the intervention is threatening to spark an all-out war.

title.children: Trump's f-bomb comment amid threat of 'full-fledged war' in Venezuela

image.altText: A close-up of Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: All signs suggest Anthony Albanese will be sticking with Plan A in his meeting with the US president on Tuesday, rather than becoming a prop for the bigger global circus.

title.children: Albanese sticking to Plan A amid the 'boiling frog syndrome' of global politics

image.altText: Max Verstappen driving during practice ar US Grand Prix.

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen topples McLaren pair Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris to claim pole position for the sprint race at the United States Grand Prix.

title.children: Verstappen turns up heat on Piastri, Norris at US Grand Prix

image.altText: a woman in high vis stands arms folded in front of mining vehicle

props.synopsis: A woman who overcame a rare disease and another who spent two decades applying for apprenticeships have been recognised for excellence in their trades.Â

title.children: Electrician says she applied for 18 years before receiving apprenticeship

image.altText: Building gen Borroloola 2

props.synopsis: Remote NT residents are calling on the government to fund new housing in the Gulf community of Borroloola, fearing limited access to appropriate homes has forced families to move off country.

title.children: Family split by lack of housing, forced off country

image.altText: Woman sitting on swings in park

props.synopsis: This game revealed how rarely we are vulnerable in front of our children, and in front of each other.Â

title.children: The simplest questions reveal what we all have in common

image.altText: Jeremy Allen White as Bruce Springsteen

props.synopsis: From the highly anticipated Bruce Springsteen biopic to a horror movie from the viewpoint of the family pup, here are the films filling up cinemas in October.

title.children: Which movies to catch and which to avoid in October

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: When police announced a new search for a missing four-year-old earlier this week, it came with a renewed hope for answers. But the latest search came to an end on Friday with crews finding no sign of little Gus.

title.children: Renewed search for Gus concludes without answers

image.altText: CCTV vision of a woman about the stab another woman in broad daylight.

props.synopsis: A woman stabbed in Melbourne's CBD is making a physical recovery from the incident, but is still struggling with the emotional aftermath, her family says.

title.children: Melbourne stabbing victim still wary of going out alone, family says

image.altText: A landscape photo of bright blue water crashing with waves along a rocky coastline with trees and blue sky.

props.synopsis: On Christmas Island, locals are not surprised if tourists' checked baggage does not arrive with them. Fragile supply chains on the remote Indian Ocean island are a part of life in this unique community.

title.children: Christmas Island wants more tourists but luggage is 'regularly' left behind

image.altText: Silver letters on a large white courthouse read: Supreme Court

props.synopsis: A leaked email shows the Northern Territory's highest-ranking judge wrote to a government department asking it not to interfere with the Supreme Court's independence. A courts spokesperson has since said the email was the result of a misunderstanding.

title.children: Top judge tells NT government to stop interfering with courts in leaked email

image.altText: A group of people sit at a wooden bench in a courtroom.

props.synopsis: The Administrative Review Tribunal was set up to resolve issues with its predecessor, but has struggled with staffing and long wait times over its first year.

title.children: Government review body suffering 'chronic short-staffing', surge in demand

image.altText: A generic photo of two teenage schoolkids sitting side by side, using their phones.

props.synopsis: Some parents may feel distressed and ill-equipped to tackle the issue of image-based abuse and deepfakes. This is what to watch out for.Â

title.children: Creating deepfakes has never been easier, so what should parents do?

image.altText: A black and white image of a woman kneeling and painting dots on a canvas.

props.synopsis: The murder of Michelle Bright altered Abby-Lee Honeysett's childhood in Gulgong, New South Wales and guided her towards a career in forensic medicine.

title.children: A 1999 murder changed a town and shaped a woman's career

image.altText: A blonde woman name Hannah Beazley being interviewed in a television studio.

props.synopsis: Voting in council elections could become mandatory in Western Australia if the turnout for this weekend's poll continues to plummet, the local government minister warns.

title.children: West Australians face compulsory council election voting amid low turnout

image.altText: Blaithin Bogue and Kate Shierlaw celebrate, approaching each other for a hug

props.synopsis: Having developed the program layer by layer since joining the AFLW in 2019, North Melbourne's disciplined, professional style of footy is forcing the rest of the league to rise to their level.

title.children: How North Melbourne are setting new AFLW standards in 2025

image.altText: He Weidong in formal military clothing standing while frowning next to Xi Jinping in a black suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: He Weidong, China's second-most-senior general, and navy admiral Miao Hua, the military's former top political officer, have been accused of "serious duty-related crimes involving an extremely large amount of money".

title.children: China expels top-ranking military leaders from Communist Party

image.altText: Burnt forest on the coast.

props.synopsis: The success of a small, autumn prescribed burn on WA's south coast has prompted calls to replace the regular program to reduce environmental damage.

title.children: Call to expand 'cool weather' burns to protect the environment

image.altText: A young woman with long, curly, brown hair sits on a couch. She wears a white blouse with black polka dots and ruffled sleeves.

props.synopsis: Chronic pain affects one in five Australian children. Two young people who experience it want more people to understand their conditions and better support for all children in pain.

title.children: 'I may have arthritis but I am not old': Growing up with chronic pain

image.altText: A man sits on an old plough with horses in the foreground

props.synopsis: Aleks Berzins is farming the land in the same way his grandfather did, using draught horses for jobs now widely done by machines.

title.children: Old fashioned farming with heavy horses

image.altText: A soldier in a helmet and uniform, and holding a machine gun, looks out of a small hole in a stone wall.

props.synopsis: The attack on a military base near the Afghanistan border comes as Taliban and Pakistani officials say a peace deal has been extended.

title.children: Suicide bomb attack kills soldiers in Pakistan as truce with Afghanistan is extended

image.altText: A black-and-white, archival image of Melbourne philanthropist Millie Tallis.

props.synopsis: One hundred years ago, showgirl-turned-philanthropist Millie Tallis spent weeks preparing for a major second-hand goods fundraiser in Melbourne, giving rise to the Australian op shop.

title.children: Australia has thousands of op shops. They started with one woman's idea
